timeline.bodyText: Why did we add null check here but nowhere else?

timeline.bodyText: Let's just update the internal APIs to take the onlyIfUnchanged boolean instead of adding the logic twice.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

We need to change to ifMatch and ifNoneMatch to match the headers.

timeline.bodyText: Why are only the sync methods updated?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -231,15 +241,18 @@ public Indexer createOrUpdateIndexer(Indexer indexer) {
      * Creates a new Azure Cognitive Search indexer or updates an indexer if it already exists.
      *
      * @param indexer The definition of the indexer to create or update.
-     * @param accessCondition the condition where the operation will be performed if the ETag on the server matches or
+     * @param onlyIfUnchanged the condition where the operation will be performed if the ETag on the server matches or
      * doesn't match specified values
      * @param requestOptions additional parameters for the operation. Contains the tracking ID sent with the request to
      * help with debugging
      * @param context additional context that is passed through the HTTP pipeline during the service call
      * @return A response object containing the Indexer.
      */
-    public Response<Indexer> createOrUpdateIndexerWithResponse(Indexer indexer, MatchConditions accessCondition,
+    public Response<Indexer> createOrUpdateIndexerWithResponse(Indexer indexer, Boolean onlyIfUnchanged,

timeline.bodyText: Why use a Boolean? boolean should work the same without having the confusing null case.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Not a huge fan to switching this to Indexer just to support simpler ETag matching. We switched the burden from creating a simple MatchConditions class to creating a Indexer class.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
Exactly a valid point.
@heaths do you have any comments on this?
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText:
See https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/general_design.html#conditional-requests
This is a pattern established in AppConfiguration and simplifies how developers use ETag. No one else seems to expose MatchConditions directly. But even if we did, in order to use the ETag of an index (or any model), you would've had to retrieved it. So you already have it, right?
replies.author: heaths

timeline.message: Make changes to service api layer.

timeline.bodyText:
The documentation shouldn't contain implementation details.
@param onlyIfUnchanged {@code true} to update if the {@code dataSource} is the same as the current service value. {@code false} to always update existing value.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Same with any other instances of this.
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText:
Let's remove this method and keep ETag retrieval scoped to the individual call. Right now this is using reflection to retrieve a known field when using an Index, Indexer, etc.
Let's keep the logic simple and repetitive in the package private methods that call into the implementation layer by having them use getETag on the object they are working with.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft
